20101221040217.000|20101221040218.000|CC1|CONGRESS STILL HAS A FEW MORE   
20101221040218.000|20101221040220.000|CC1|TRICKS UP ITS SLEEVE, PROVING,  
20101221040220.000|20101221040223.000|CC1|IN A PAINFULLY MIXED METAPHOR,  
20101221040223.000|20101221040224.000|CC1|THAT SOME LAME DUCKS STILL KNOW 
20101221040224.000|20101221040225.000|CC1|HOW TO FLY.                     
20101221040225.000|20101221040227.000|CC1|BY A VOTE OF 65-31 SATURDAY, THE
20101221040227.000|20101221040229.000|CC1|U.S. SENATE PASSED A BILL

20101221040230.000|20101221040230.000|CC1|BE SIGNED INTO LAW BY THE       
20101221040230.000|20101221040232.000|CC1|PRESIDENT WEDNESDAY.            
20101221040232.000|20101221040234.000|CC1|REPEALING DON'T ASK, DON'T TELL,
20101221040234.000|20101221040235.000|CC1|ALLOWING GAY AND LESBIAN        
20101221040235.000|20101221040236.000|CC1|AMERICANS TO SERVE IN THE ARMED 
20101221040236.000|20101221040238.000|CC1|SERVICES OPENLY.

20101221040239.000|20101221040241.000|CC1|THAT THE VOTE CULMINATES WHAT   
20101221040241.000|20101221040243.000|CC1|WAS, IN EFFECT, A LONG-TERM     
20101221040243.000|20101221040244.000|CC1|WHITE HOUSE STRATEGY TO ENSURE  
20101221040244.000|20101221040245.000|CC1|THAT REPEAL WOULD PASS WITH     
20101221040245.000|20101221040247.000|CC1|SUPPORT FROM THE PENTAGON.      
20101221040247.000|20101221040249.000|CC1|AND THEREFORE MEMBERS OF        
20101221040249.000|20101221040251.000|CC1|CONGRESS MAKING IT LESS         
20101221040251.000|20101221040252.000|CC1|VULNERABLE TO SUBSEQUENT        
20101221040252.000|20101221040253.000|CC1|RESTORATION THAN IF A COURT     
20101221040253.000|20101221040255.000|CC1|REPEALED IT.

20101221040256.000|20101221040257.000|CC1|NATIONAL JOURNAL" REPORTS, TOLD 
20101221040257.000|20101221040259.000|CC1|THE WHITE HOUSE AFTER THE HOUSE 
20101221040259.000|20101221040300.000|CC1|PASSED REPEAL, THAT THEY COULD

20101221040305.000|20101221040307.000|CC1|IN JUST A MOMENT WE'LL PLAY JOHN
20101221040307.000|20101221040309.000|CC1|McCAIN WHINING ABOUT THE REPEAL

20101221040459.000|20101221040501.000|CC1|BECOME THE GENERAL STATUTES OF  
20101221040501.000|20101221040502.000|CC1|THE UNITED STATES, THIS HISTORIC
20101221040502.000|20101221040503.000|CC1|VOTE WILL BE REMEMBERED AS A

20101221040506.000|20101221040507.000|CC1|AND THIS IS A PRESIDENT WHO

20101221040509.000|20101221040509.000|CC1|YOU KNOW.

20101221040512.000|20101221040513.000|CC1|SUPPORTERS ARE SO PROUD OF IT.

20101221040517.000|20101221040519.000|CC1|IN S.T.A.R.T. DOES PASS, WHICH  
20101221040519.000|20101221040521.000|CC1|IT'S NOW LOOKING LIKE IT WILL.  
20101221040521.000|20101221040522.000|CC1|WE'LL GET TO THAT IN A SECOND.  
20101221040522.000|20101221040524.000|CC1|I GUESS I'M TRYING TO GET MY

20101221040525.000|20101221040528.000|CC1|GOTTEN SO MUCH DONE WHEN THERE'S
20101221040528.000|20101221040529.000|CC1|BEEN SO MUCH FOOT TRACKING, SO  
20101221040529.000|20101221040531.000|CC1|MUCH OBSTRUCTION FOR SUCH A LONG
20101221040531.000|20101221040532.000|CC1|PERIOD OF TIME FOR THE LAST TWO 
20101221040532.000|20101221040534.000|CC1|YEARS, WHAT IS IT ABOUT THIS    
20101221040534.000|20101221040534.000|CC1|LAME DUCK?

20101221040542.000|20101221040543.000|CC1|>> WELL, WE'RE REPORTERS.       
20101221040543.000|20101221040547.000|CC1|WE KNOW HOW DEADLINES LIKE A

20101221040551.000|20101221040554.000|CC1|THAT POST-ELECTION, SOME

20101221040555.000|20101221040557.000|CC1|SOME DEMOCRATS, ARE FREED UP    
20101221040557.000|20101221040601.000|CC1|FROM THE STRICTURES OF THE      
20101221040601.000|20101221040601.000|CC1|CAMPAIGN SEASON.                
20101221040601.000|20101221040602.000|CC1|THERE ARE OPPORTUNITIES FOR     
20101221040602.000|20101221040604.000|CC1|PEOPLE TO VOTE THEIR CONSCIENCE.
20101221040604.000|20101221040605.000|CC1|I THINK THAT HAPPENED ON THE    
20101221040605.000|20101221040606.000|CC1|DON'T ASK, DON'T TELL VOTE IN   
20101221040606.000|20101221040607.000|CC1|TERMS OF SOME REPUBLICAN VOTES

20101221040608.000|20101221040610.000|CC1|I THINK JOE LIEBERMAN, CREDIT

20101221040616.000|20101221040618.000|CC1|HE REALLY WORKED HARD ON DON'T  
20101221040618.000|20101221040619.000|CC1|ASK, DON'T TELL.                
20101221040619.000|20101221040620.000|CC1|AND I THINK ALSO SORT OF THE    
20101221040620.000|20101221040622.000|CC1|ACCIDENT, IF YOU WILL, OR THE   
20101221040622.000|20101221040624.000|CC1|PRESIDENT'S DECISION TO PLAY ON 
20101221040624.000|20101221040625.000|CC1|REPUBLICAN TURF ON THE TAX BILL 
20101221040625.000|20101221040628.000|CC1|WHICH IS, AFTER ALL, WHAT HE    
20101221040628.000|20101221040628.000|CC1|DID.                            
20101221040628.000|20101221040630.000|CC1|THAT CREATED, HOWEVER           
20101221040630.000|20101221040632.000|CC1|TEMPORARILY, SORT OF A SPIRITED 
20101221040632.000|20101221040632.000|CC1|BIPARTISANSHIP THAT WILL

20101221042009.000|20101221042010.000|CC1|>>> TONIGHT, CITING SENIOR      
20101221042010.000|20101221042012.000|CC1|AGENCY OFFICIALS, REUTERS IS    
20101221042012.000|20101221042013.000|CC1|REPORTING THAT THE FEDERAL      
20101221042013.000|20101221042014.000|CC1|COMMUNICATIONS COMMISSION HAS   
20101221042014.000|20101221042016.000|CC1|THE VOTES TO APPROVE THEIR      
20101221042016.000|20101221042018.000|CC1|VERSION OF NET NEUTRALITY.      
20101221042018.000|20101221042020.000|CC1|IN OUR FOURTH STORY, THE FCC    
20101221042020.000|20101221042022.000|CC1|PLAN HAS BEEN PILLORIED ON BOTH 
20101221042022.000|20101221042022.000|CC1|SIDES OF THE AISLE SINCE IT WAS 
20101221042022.000|20101221042025.000|CC1|ANNOUNCED.                      
20101221042025.000|20101221042026.000|CC1|SENATOR AL FRANKEN SATURDAY SAID
20101221042026.000|20101221042027.000|CC1|THE PLAN WOULD DO, QUOTE, MORE  
20101221042027.000|20101221042030.000|CC1|HARM THAN DOING NOTHING AT ALL. 
20101221042030.000|20101221042031.000|CC1|TODAY, A REPUBLICAN COMMISSION  
20101221042031.000|20101221042033.000|CC1|MEMBER, CALLING THE EFFORT,     
20101221042033.000|20101221042034.000|CC1|QUOTE, JAW-DROPPING             
20101221042034.000|20101221042035.000|CC1|INTERVENTIONIST CHUTZPAH.       
20101221042035.000|20101221042036.000|CC1|PHRASE OF THE YEAR.             
20101221042036.000|20101221042037.000|CC1|THE FINAL VOTE SHOULD COME      
20101221042037.000|20101221042039.000|CC1|TOMORROW MORNING.               
20101221042039.000|20101221042040.000|CC1|BEFORE THAT, INTERNET LAW       
20101221042040.000|20101221042045.000|CC1|EXPERT, MARVIN AMOREY WILL HELP 
20101221042045.000|20101221042046.000|CC1|US SORT ALL THIS OUT.           
20101221042046.000|20101221042047.000|CC1|IF THE PLAN DOES GET THE        
20101221042047.000|20101221042051.000|CC1|NECESSARY FCC VOTES TOMORROW,   
20101221042051.000|20101221042052.000|CC1|THE WHITE HOUSE WILL CLAIM IT AS
20101221042052.000|20101221042054.000|CC1|A REALIZATION OF A CAMPAIGN     
20101221042054.000|20101221042057.000|CC1|PROMISE MADE YEARS AGO ON THE   
20101221042057.000|20101221042058.000|CC1|GOOGLE CAMPUS BY THEN SENATOR   
20101221042058.000|20101221042058.000|CC1|BARACK OBAMA.                   
20101221042058.000|20101221042100.000|CC1|>> I WILL TAKE A BACKSEAT TO NO 
20101221042100.000|20101221042102.000|CC1|ONE IN MY COMMITMENT TO NETWORK 
20101221042102.000|20101221042104.000|CC1|NEUTRALITY.                     
20101221042104.000|20101221042105.000|CC1|BECAUSE ONCE PROVIDERS START TO 
20101221042105.000|20101221042107.000|CC1|PRIVILEGE SOME APPLICATIONS OR  
20101221042107.000|20101221042109.000|CC1|WEBSITES OVER OTHERS, THEN THE  
20101221042109.000|20101221042110.000|CC1|SMALLER VOICES GET SQUEEZED OUT 
20101221042110.000|20101221042112.000|CC1|AND WE ALL LOSE.                
20101221042112.000|20101221042114.000|CC1|>> IN OTHER WORDS, BIG PROVIDERS
20101221042114.000|20101221042116.000|CC1|LIKE VERIZON, AT&T, OR COMCAST  
20101221042116.000|20101221042117.000|CC1|CAN'T USE THEIR SIZE AND        
20101221042117.000|20101221042119.000|CC1|INFLUENCE TO DROWN OUT THE      
20101221042119.000|20101221042121.000|CC1|CONTENT OF SMALLER COMPETITORS. 
20101221042121.000|20101221042123.000|CC1|BY THE WAY,                     
20101221042123.000|20101221042124.000|CC1|COMCAST IS CURRENTLY IN         
20101221042124.000|20101221042127.000|CC1|NEGOTIATIONS TO BUY THIS        
20101221042127.000|20101221042129.000|CC1|NETWORK'S PARENT COMPANY, NBC   
20101221042129.000|20101221042129.000|CC1|UNIVERSAL.                      
20101221042129.000|20101221042130.000|CC1|PUT IT ANOTHER WAY.             
20101221042130.000|20101221042131.000|CC1|AS LONG AS YOUR MANY INTERNETS  
20101221042131.000|20101221042132.000|CC1|ARE NEUTRAL, YOU CAN WATCH THE  
20101221042132.000|20101221042135.000|CC1|TRAILER FOR THE NEW "TRON       
20101221042135.000|20101221042138.000|CC1|LEGACY'S" MOVIE AS YOU CAN FOR  
20101221042138.000|20101221042142.000|CC1|THE 2004 TRON GUY YOUTUBE VIDEO.
20101221042142.000|20101221042143.000|CC1|NO SLOW BUFFERING FOR THE       
20101221042143.000|20101221042144.000|CC1|INDEPENDENT TRON GUY.           
20101221042144.000|20101221042145.000|CC1|HE HAS THE SAME SHOT TO BE SEEN 
20101221042145.000|20101221042146.000|CC1|AS THE BIG-TIME DISNEY FLICK.   
20101221042146.000|20101221042147.000|CC1|USERS HAVE THE SAME ACCESS AND  
20101221042147.000|20101221042148.000|CC1|CHOOSE WHICH ONE THEY LIKE      
20101221042148.000|20101221042150.000|CC1|BETTER.                         
20101221042150.000|20101221042155.000|CC1|BACK TO THE FCC.                
20101221042155.000|20101221042200.000|CC1|ON DECEMBER 1st, CHAIRMAN JULIUS
20101221042200.000|20101221042201.000|CC1|JANIKOWSKI ISSUED HIS DRAFT     
20101221042201.000|20101221042202.000|CC1|RULES FOR NET NEUTRALITY.       
20101221042202.000|20101221042203.000|CC1|TELLING "THE NEW YORK TIMES"    
20101221042203.000|20101221042204.000|CC1|BLOG TODAY, "THESE RULES APPEAR 
20101221042204.000|20101221042205.000|CC1|TO BE FLUSH WITH GIANT LOOPHOLES
20101221042205.000|20101221042208.000|CC1|AND THE FCC CHAIRMAN SEEMS FOR A
20101221042208.000|20101221042209.000|CC1|MORE CONCERNED WITH WINNING THE 
20101221042209.000|20101221042211.000|CC1|ENDORSEMENT OF AT&T AND THE

20101221042214.000|20101221042214.000|CC1|HAVE PLEADED WITH HIM TO FIX HIS
20101221042214.000|20101221042216.000|CC1|PROPOSAL.

20101221042220.000|20101221042223.000|CC1|MEMBERS WERE SAID TO HAVE BEEN  
20101221042223.000|20101221042225.000|CC1|CONCERNED ABOUT THE POSSIBILITY 
20101221042225.000|20101221042226.000|CC1|OF PAID PRIORITIZATION,         
20101221042226.000|20101221042227.000|CC1|THE IDEA THAT PROVIDERS WHO CAN

20101221042259.000|20101221042300.000|CC1|DON'T KNOW EXACTLY WHAT'S IN IT.

20101221042302.000|20101221042304.000|CC1|THE THINGS THAT SOUND PROMISING,
20101221042304.000|20101221042306.000|CC1|AND WHAT ARE THE THINGS THAT

20101221042317.000|20101221042319.000|CC1|ARE MANY, THAT ALL OF WIRELESS, 
20101221042319.000|20101221042321.000|CC1|ACCESS TO THE INTERNET THROUGH  
20101221042321.000|20101221042323.000|CC1|WIRELESS, IS EXEMPTED.          
20101221042323.000|20101221042324.000|CC1|SO IF YOU THINK YOU'RE GETTING A
20101221042324.000|20101221042325.000|CC1|HALF A LOAF, IF YOU'RE THE KIND 
20101221042325.000|20101221042325.000|CC1|OF PERSON WHO GETS THE INTERNET 
20101221042325.000|20101221042326.000|CC1|THROUGH WIRELESS CONNECTIONS,   
20101221042326.000|20101221042331.000|CC1|YOU'RE GETTING NO LOAF AT ALL.  
20101221042331.000|20101221042335.000|CC1|AND INCREASINGLY, MORE PEOPLE   
20101221042335.000|20101221042338.000|CC1|USE WIRELESS ACCESS TO THE      
20101221042338.000|20101221042339.000|CC1|INTERNET THAN EVEN WIRELINE     
20101221042339.000|20101221042340.000|CC1|CONNECTIONS.                    
20101221042340.000|20101221042341.000|CC1|>> SO THERE'S GOING TO BE A     
20101221042341.000|20101221042342.000|CC1|DISTINCTION IN THE FCC BILL,    
20101221042342.000|20101221042342.000|CC1|FROM MY UNDERSTANDING, THERE WAS
20101221042342.000|20101221042343.000|CC1|A DEAL CUT THAT SAID, WE'RE     
20101221042343.000|20101221042344.000|CC1|GOING TO HAVE SOME VERSION OF   
20101221042344.000|20101221042345.000|CC1|NET NEUTRALITY ON BROADBAND, BUT
20101221042345.000|20101221042345.000|CC1|NOTHING ON THE WIRELESS SIDE,   
20101221042345.000|20101221042347.000|CC1|WHICH IS YOUR SMARTPHONE.       
20101221042347.000|20101221042348.000|CC1|>> EXACTLY -- WELL, YOUR        
20101221042348.000|20101221042352.000|CC1|SMARTPHONE, BUT YOU CAN USE A   
20101221042352.000|20101221042355.000|CC1|VIDEO CARD ON YOUR LAPTOP.      
20101221042355.000|20101221042359.000|CC1|IF YOU'RE USING AN EVDO CARD ON 
20101221042359.000|20101221042400.000|CC1|YOUR LAPTOP, YOU GET A DIFFERENT
20101221042400.000|20101221042401.000|CC1|INTERNET CONNECTION AND         
20101221042401.000|20101221042402.000|CC1|EXPERIENCE THAN YOU COULD GET ON
20101221042402.000|20101221042403.000|CC1|YOUR WIRELINE CONNECTION AND    
20101221042403.000|20101221042404.000|CC1|IT'S REALLY THE SAME INTERNET.  
20101221042404.000|20101221042404.000|CC1|SO IT'S AN EXEMPTION FOR AT&T   
20101221042404.000|20101221042405.000|CC1|AND VERIZON, TO BENEFIT THEM.   
20101221042405.000|20101221042407.000|CC1|ON THE WIRE LINE SIDE, YOU HAVE 
20101221042407.000|20101221042409.000|CC1|MORE SUBTLE EXCEPTIONS.         
20101221042409.000|20101221042413.000|CC1|BUT ON THE WIRELESS SIDE, IT'S  
20101221042413.000|20101221042414.000|CC1|JUST A FREE-FOR-ALL.            
20101221042414.000|20101221042415.000|CC1|>> LET ME PURSUE ON THE WIRELESS
20101221042415.000|20101221042415.000|CC1|SIDE.                           
20101221042415.000|20101221042417.000|CC1|THIS IS THE ARGUMENT THAT THE   
20101221042417.000|20101221042418.000|CC1|PROVIDERS MAKE THAT, LOOK, THIS 
20101221042418.000|20101221042419.000|CC1|IS EXPENSIVE, BANDWIDTH IS A    
20101221042419.000|20101221042420.000|CC1|FINITE RESOURCE, AT LEAST AS OUR
20101221042420.000|20101221042422.000|CC1|NETWORKS ARE CURRENTLY

20101221042512.000|20101221042513.000|CC1|>> IT SEEMS LIKE, AS DRAFTED, AT
20101221042513.000|20101221042517.000|CC1|LEAST AS I UNDERSTAND IT, AND MY

20101221042531.000|20101221042532.000|CC1|>> YEAH.

20101221042533.000|20101221042536.000|CC1|CONTENT, FROM WHAT I HEAR.      
20101221042536.000|20101221042541.000|CC1|BUT THE EFFECT OF THIS DECISION 
20101221042541.000|20101221042542.000|CC1|WILL BE SIMILAR TO THE EFFECT

20101221042600.000|20101221042601.000|CC1|THIS FAST SUPERHIGHWAY OF       
20101221042601.000|20101221042602.000|CC1|PRIVILEGED CONTENT FOR THE VERY 
20101221042602.000|20101221042603.000|CC1|POWERFUL AND WEALTHY, THEN      
20101221042603.000|20101221042604.000|CC1|PEOPLE WILL HAVE TO SPEND, YOU

20101221042606.000|20101221042607.000|CC1|SPEND A LOT OF MONEY TO REACH

20101221042610.000|20101221042611.000|CC1|SO PEOPLE -- SO EVEN IF YOU

20101221042613.000|20101221042614.000|CC1|YOU END UP PRIVILEGING THE

20101221042619.000|20101221042621.000|CC1|>> YOU'RE SAYING YOU CAN'T

20101221042623.000|20101221042625.000|CC1|THEY'RE SO ENTWINED.            
20101221042625.000|20101221042626.000|CC1|>> THEY ARE, INDEED.            
20101221042626.000|20101221042627.000|CC1|IF YOU THINK A LOT OF THE       
20101221042627.000|20101221042629.000|CC1|ECONOMIC INNOVATIONS, LIKE

20101221042634.000|20101221042635.000|CC1|AND THE SAME WAY THAT MAYBE THE 
20101221042635.000|20101221042637.000|CC1|FRANKEN CAMPAIGN OR             
20101221042637.000|20101221042639.000|CC1|SAVETHEINTERNET.COM CAN'T PAY   
20101221042639.000|20101221042642.000|CC1|FOR THE SPECIAL ACCESS, THAT    
20101221042642.000|20101221042644.000|CC1|OTHER COMPANIES COULD PAY FOR,  
20101221042644.000|20101221042645.000|CC1|THEY'RE AT A DISADVANTAGE.      
20101221042645.000|20101221042646.000|CC1|AND ON THE WIRELESS SIDE,       
20101221042646.000|20101221042647.000|CC1|SAVETHEINTERNET.COM COULD BE    
20101221042647.000|20101221042649.000|CC1|BLOCKED ALTOGETHER.             
20101221042649.000|20101221042650.000|CC1|>> FINALLY, THERE'S BEEN A LOT  
20101221042650.000|20101221042654.000|CC1|OF CHALLENGES TO THE LEGAL      
20101221042654.000|20101221042654.000|CC1|AUTHORITY OF THE FCC TO         
20101221042654.000|20101221042657.000|CC1|REGULATE.                       
20101221042657.000|20101221042658.000|CC1|WHAT IS YOUR SENSE OF WHAT'S    
20101221042658.000|20101221042659.000|CC1|GOING TO HAPPEN AFTER, IF THE   
20101221042659.000|20101221042700.000|CC1|COMMISSION PASSES THIS, AS      
20101221042700.000|20101221042701.000|CC1|EXPECTED, WHAT'S GOING TO HAPPEN
20101221042701.000|20101221042703.000|CC1|AFTER THAT?                     
20101221042703.000|20101221042709.000|CC1|>> WE'LL PROBABLY SEE A LAWSUIT 
20101221042709.000|20101221042709.000|CC1|AND THIS WILL PROBABLY BE STRUCK
20101221042709.000|20101221042711.000|CC1|DOWN.                           
20101221042711.000|20101221042716.000|CC1|THE FCC BASED THEIR JURISDICTION
20101221042716.000|20101221042718.000|CC1|ON TITLE 1, THE TITLE OF THE    
20101221042718.000|20101221042720.000|CC1|ACT, IN WHICH THE COURTS HAVE   
20101221042720.000|20101221042720.000|CC1|ALREADY SAID THAT'S NOT A GOOD  
20101221042720.000|20101221042721.000|CC1|BASIS OF JURISDICTION FOR NET   
20101221042721.000|20101221042722.000|CC1|NEUTRALITY.                     
20101221042722.000|20101221042722.000|CC1|SO I FULLY EXPECT IT TO BE      
20101221042722.000|20101221042723.000|CC1|STRUCK DOWN AFTER LITIGATION.   
20101221042723.000|20101221042724.000|CC1|AND THE QUESTION IS, WHAT       
20101221042724.000|20101221042726.000|CC1|HAPPENS THEN?

20101221044349.000|20101221044349.000|CC1|  Lunesta helps you fall asleep 
20101221044349.000|20101221044352.000|CC1|        and stay asleep,        
20101221044352.000|20101221044352.000|CC1|           so you can           
20101221044352.000|20101221044354.000|CC1|     wake up feeling rested.    
20101221044354.000|20101221044354.000|CC1|When taking Lunesta, don't drive
20101221044354.000|20101221044357.000|CC1|      or operate machinery      
20101221044357.000|20101221044359.000|CC1|   until you feel fully awake.  
20101221044359.000|20101221044359.000|CC1|    Walking, eating, driving,   
20101221044359.000|20101221044402.000|CC1| or engaging in other activities
20101221044402.000|20101221044402.000|CC1|      while asleep, without     
20101221044402.000|20101221044404.000|CC1|  remembering it the next day,  
20101221044404.000|20101221044406.000|CC1|       have been reported.      
20101221044406.000|20101221044406.000|CC1| Abnormal behaviors may include 
20101221044406.000|20101221044408.000|CC1|   aggressiveness, agitation,   
20101221044408.000|20101221044410.000|CC1|  hallucinations or confusion.

20101221044410.000|20101221044412.000|CC1|    worsening of depression,    
20101221044412.000|20101221044412.000|CC1|   including risk of suicide,   
20101221044412.000|20101221044414.000|CC1|           may occur.           
20101221044414.000|20101221044414.000|CC1|           Alcohol may          
20101221044414.000|20101221044416.000|CC1|      increase these risks.     
20101221044416.000|20101221044416.000|CC1|    Allergic reactions, such    
20101221044416.000|20101221044418.000|CC1|  as tongue or throat swelling, 
20101221044418.000|20101221044420.000|CC1| occur rarely and may be fatal. 
20101221044420.000|20101221044420.000|CC1|    Side effects may include    
20101221044420.000|20101221044423.000|CC1|   unpleasant taste, headache,  
20101221044423.000|20101221044423.000|CC1|            dizziness

20101221045441.000|20101221045447.000|CC1|GOVERNOR TERRY                  
20101221045447.000|20101221045447.000|CC1|GODDARD, A WOMAN WHO CALLED THE

20101221045500.000|20101221045500.000|CC1|EXPRESS DISAPPOINTMENT WITH THE
